tl3.query module#

tl3.query.delete_credentials_cache()[source]#

Deletes the local Space-Track credentials cache. Use only if you want to re-input the username and password for whatever reason.

tl3.query.fill_tle_gaps(tle_dir: str = None, **kwargs) → None[source]#

Looks for and fills individual days without TLEs in the text cache

Parameters:

tle_dir (str, optional) – Directory to search, defaults to None (if None, uses the default internal location ./txt/)

tl3.query.get_tle_file_list(tle_dir: str = None) → list[str][source]#

Returns a list of the .txt files in a directory

Parameters:

tle_dir (str, optional) – Directory to search for TLEs, defaults to None (uses the default internal location ./txt/)

Returns:

List of absolute file paths, sorted by increasing date

Return type:

list[str]

tl3.query.get_tle_file_list_as_dates(tle_dir: str = None) → list[tuple[date, date]][source]#

Lists the contents of the TLE directory as a list of tuples of date limits for each file

Parameters:

tle_dir (str, optional) – Directory to search for TLEs, defaults to None (uses the default internal location ./txt/)

Returns:

List of beginning and ending date tuples for each file, sorted by increasing date

Return type:

list[tuple[datetime.date, datetime.date]]

tl3.query.load_query_dates() → list[tuple[date, date]][source]#

Loads the historical TLE query dates. Note that these are distributed such that each resulting .txt file is about 20 MB (~150k TLEs)

Returns:

Pairs of query datetimes, increasing in the list and increasing within the tuple entries

Return type:

list[tuple[datetime.date, datetime.date]]

tl3.query.save_tles(dates: list[tuple[date, date]], save_dir: str = None, endpoint: str = 'tle', skip_existing: bool = True)[source]#

Queries and saves TLEs for a set of pairs of datetimes

Parameters:

  • dates (list[datetime.date]) – Dates to query pairs for

  • save_dir (bool, optional) – Directory to save .txts of TLEs to, defaults to None (the default internal package destination ./txt/*.txt)

  • endpoint (str, optional) – The Space-Track endpoint to query, defaults to ‘tle’

  • skip_existing (bool, optional) – Whether to skip pairs of dates where the TLE file has already been saved, defaults to True

tl3.query.update_tle_cache(tle_dir: str = None) → None[source]#

Updates the cache with any new TLEs up to the beginning of the last UTC day

Parameters:

tle_dir (str, optional) – Directory to search for TLE .txt files, defaults to None (defaults to the internal destination ./txt/)
